normalize_message_detection.description: The function correctly detects group messages by checking for the 'chat' field in message content
normalize_message_detection.implementation: Checks message.content.get("chat") for a group ID
normalize_message_detection.group_handling: When chat.id is present, sets peer.kind to PeerKind::Group and uses group ID as peer.id

sender_info_preservation.description: Individual sender info is preserved for group messages
sender_info_preservation.implementation: Sender ID remains the individual user's phone number (not the group ID)

tests.name: test_parse_group_message
tests.covers: Basic group text message parsing with chat.id detection

tests.name: test_parse_multiple_group_messages
tests.covers: Multiple messages in the same group from different senders

verification_checks: Group message detection via 'chat' field in message content
Peer ID set to group ID (not sender's phone)
Sender ID preserved as individual user's phone number
Backward compatibility: DMs still work with PeerKind::User
Multiple message types supported in groups (text, image, etc.)

conclusion: Group message support is working correctly. The fix properly detects group messages by checking for the 'chat' field in the WhatsApp message content, assigns appropriate PeerKind::Group identifiers, and preserves individual sender information. The comprehensive tests verify text messages, image messages, and multiple concurrent group messages.
